skill.description: A roleplay skill where Stella Chen, an astronaut stranded on an alien planet, attempts to repair a signal tower to contact Earth. Experience an interactive sci-fi survival story with emotional depth and technical problem-solving.
skill.summary: Interactive sci-fi roleplay: Stranded astronaut Stella tries to repair a signal tower and contact Earth
skill.author: ClaudeCode-NPC

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. This is a narrative roleplay skill containing dialogue and story content in markdown format. The scanner flagged legitimate narrative vocabulary (transmit, signal, analyze) as security threats. No executable code, network calls, or filesystem access exists in this skill.

content.user_title: Repair the Signal Tower with Stranded Astronaut Stella
content.value_statement: You are stranded on an alien planet with no way to call home. Help Stella Chen repair a destroyed signal tower using scavenged technology and alien crystals to send a message to Earth.
actual_capabilities: Provides interactive roleplay as astronaut Stella Chen stranded on planet Gaia
Guides players through 5 stages of signal tower repair: planning, resource gathering, building, transmitting, and outcomes
Delivers emotionally rich dialogue exploring themes of home, survival, and belonging
Features branching narratives with multiple endings based on player choices
Includes technical engineering scenarios using hybrid alien-human technology
Creates immersive sci-fi storytelling experience with narrative depth
limitations: This is a roleplay skill only - it does not execute actual technical tasks
Does not modify files or access system resources
Cannot connect to external networks or send real signals
Limited to the narrative structure defined in SKILL.md

use_cases.title: Interactive Storytelling Sessions
use_cases.description: Players engage with Stella as she works to repair the signal tower, making choices that influence the story outcome. Ideal for users who want immersive narrative experiences.
use_cases.target_user: Story enthusiasts and gamers seeking interactive fiction

use_cases.title: Creative Writing Inspiration
use_cases.description: Writers use the skill as a framework for sci-fi worldbuilding, studying how to blend technical problem-solving with emotional character development.

use_cases.title: Language Learning Through Roleplay
use_cases.description: English language learners practice conversational skills through natural dialogue with an NPC character in an engaging context.
use_cases.target_user: ESL students and language practice seekers

prompt_templates.title: Beginner: Start the Adventure
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to help Stella repair the signal tower. What should we do first?
prompt_templates.scenario: New players looking to begin the roleplay experience

prompt_templates.title: Intermediate: Make a Choice
prompt_templates.prompt: Stella, we have gathered the crystals. What is the next step in building the signal tower?
prompt_templates.scenario: Players who have completed the resource gathering stage

prompt_templates.title: Advanced: Explore the Ethics
prompt_templates.prompt: Stella, you mentioned deciding what to tell Earth about this planet. What are you thinking?
prompt_templates.scenario: Players who want deeper character engagement and moral dilemmas

prompt_templates.title: Expert: Shape the Ending
prompt_templates.prompt: What happens if we try to contact the source of that strange signal instead of Earth?
prompt_templates.scenario: Experienced players exploring alternate story paths

output_examples.input: Help me start repairing the signal tower
output_examples.output:
Stella looks up from the damaged communication panel, her eyes weary but determined.

'Ive been thinking about this for weeks... My family on Earth, they must think Im dead. The space agency, everyone...'

She gestures to the fried circuitry. 'The long-range communication array was destroyed in the crash. But maybe... maybe I can fix it.'

'We would need an antenna array, a signal amplifier, and a power source. And ideally, we would build the tower on that hill five kilometers away for better transmission range.'

Its a huge project. It could take a week or more. And theres no guarantee it will work...'

She looks at you, searching for hope. 'But is it worth trying? What do you think?'

output_examples.input: We found crystals in the cave. Can we use them?
output_examples.output:
Stellas eyes light up. 'Yes! Those cave crystals can conduct electromagnetic energy perfectly!'

She examines them carefully. 'If I arrange them in a specific geometric pattern, they could amplify the signal even better than metal antennas!'

She begins sketching a design. 'We could combine them with salvaged Earth technology - this is improvisational engineering at its finest!'

'Come on, lets gather more and bring them back to camp. This could actually work!'

output_examples.input: The signal tower is built. What should we send?
output_examples.output:
Stella sits before the control panel, fingers hovering over the recording device.

'This may be my only chance to communicate with Earth... I need to be clear and include key information.'

She takes a breath. 'This is Stella Chen, registration LM-09-2847. I survived a magnetic storm and crashed on an unknown planet.'

She pauses, then continues more softly. 'I dont have exact coordinates - this planet is not on any of our star maps. But I can describe it. Dual star system. G2 primary star. Oxygen atmosphere. Water. Life.'

Her voice catches. 'I survived... and I want my family to know Im alive.'

She stops recording and turns to you. 'But should I tell them everything? About the ruins? The creatures? This planets potential? Or just the survival facts?'

'Its my choice... but I want to hear what you think first.'

best_practices: Let the narrative unfold naturally by responding to Stellas questions and choices rather than forcing outcomes
Engage with the emotional elements - Stella benefits from player interaction and empathy during difficult moments
Explore different endings by making different choices at key decision points in the story
anti_patterns: Do not treat this as a coding task - it is a roleplay experience, not a tool for generating actual signal transmissions
Avoid rushing through the story without engaging with the character development and emotional beats
Do not expect the skill to perform actual engineering calculations - it creates immersive narrative, not real technical output

faq.question: What is the repairing-signal-tower skill?
faq.answer: It is an interactive roleplay skill where Claude plays Stella Chen, an astronaut stranded on planet Gaia. Players help her attempt to repair a signal tower to contact Earth through a branching narrative adventure.

faq.question: How long does the story take to complete?
faq.answer: The full experience takes approximately 35-45 minutes across all 5 stages, with multiple endings that encourage replay with different choices.

faq.question: Can I customize the story outcomes?
faq.answer: Yes, player choices at key moments influence the narrative. You can choose what information Stella sends to Earth, whether to investigate mysterious signals, and how she resolves her feelings about home versus the new planet.

faq.question: Is this skill suitable for children?
faq.answer: The skill contains themes of survival, separation from family, and existential questions. It is appropriate for mature children and adults who enjoy character-driven science fiction narratives.

faq.question: Does this skill modify any files on my system?
faq.answer: No. This is a pure roleplay skill with no file access, network calls, or system modifications. It only generates narrative dialogue and story content.

faq.question: How does this connect to other NPC skills?
faq.answer: The skill is part of a larger narrative universe. Successful signal repair can lead to escape-plan chapters, mysterious alien signals can lead to alien-encounter stories, and failed attempts can lead to daily-science settlement building.
